item.BitShares: Deploying a new smart-contract requires a hard-fork which is very easy to implement as all is needed is a consensus among 51% of the witness nodes.
item.Ethereum: Everybody can create and deploy a smart-contract without asking for anyone's permission.
item.TauChain: Deploying a new smart-contract requires passing automated tests for the code's semantics.

item.feature: What is the best analogy to the process of smart-contracts deployment?
item.BitShares: Apple Store - in this case quality of the "apps" deployed is verified by BitShares shareholders.
item.Ethereum: Google's Play - anybody can deploy anything.
item.TauChain: TauChain's approach is quite unprecedented as total freedom goes hand-in-hand with a guarantee regarding safety & quality of the code.

item.feature: How is the original business model behind a smart-contract protected?
item.BitShares: Shareholders are able to block deployments of smart-contracts aiming to duplicate existing functionalities.

item.feature: Can businesses profit directly from fees earned by smart-contracts which turn out to be popular?
Are businesses encouraged to build & deploy general-purpose smart-contracts (i.e. not related to any particular business)?
What entity receives revenues generated by smart-contracts?
item.BitShares: All shareholders by default. However by using Fee-Backed Assets it is possible to construct smart-contracts with a revenue distribution aimed at businesses that created them.

item.feature: What is the programming language offered for creating smart-contracts?
item.Ethereum: Several higher-level languages such as Serpent (Python inspired), Mutan (Go inspired) or LLL (LISP inspired)
item.TauChain: Not known at this stage, as a new programming language paradigm will have to be invented.
No. TauChain's assumption is that Turing-completeness is not essential for most smart-contracts.

item.feature: How lethal smart-contracts are prevented & eliminated?
item.BitShares: Prevented before deployment. A smart-contract's source code is trusted as it is reviewed by shareholders before being deployed.
item.Ethereum: Prevented during run-time. A smart-contract's execution is constantly monitored during run-time.
item.TauChain: Prevented before deployment. A smart-contract's source code is trusted as it is verified by automated tests.

item.feature: What are the consequences of the chosen lethal-code prevention method in terms of blockchain efficiency?
item.BitShares: None, smart-contracts are executed at top speed.
item.Ethereum: Huge, smart-contracts' execution is significantly slowed-down by the monitoring process.
item.TauChain: None, smart-contracts are executed at top speed.

item.feature: What are the consequences of the chosen lethal-code prevention method in terms of safety & unmanageable hard-forks?
item.Ethereum: Constant danger of unknown loopholes in the system.
